messages.message:
@sean.donohoe on master, it seems like the go fmt logic changed:
• imports are no longer sorted with "instabase/..." to the end
• pushes the ")" of function return types to a new line
Are these changes intentional? Wondering if I did something wrong

hey, could be related to this PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/67155) I merged this morning (more context here (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1738172125641769)) -- will take a look!

Looks like I missed `"go.formatTool": "goimports"` in the new config, which would explain the import organization -- I'll put up a change for that in a bit, but you can also add it before then by editing `$IB_HOME/.vscode/settings.json`, sorry for the annoyance!
hm i can't get it to work
interesting -- could you share the "Go" task output? seems like the extension didn't reload as expected or theres some other setting specific to your host that's conflicting
sure, but i don't see anything meaningful
fwiw this is what I see when saving / undoing format changes
oh ok. looks like we are seeing the same result. "instabase/..." was sorted to the end but now it seems like we just sort alphabetically

Ah I see -- because we don't follow the go coding standard of prefixing all third party modules with a url (i.e. we do `instabase` instead of the expected `github.com/instabase/instabase (http://github.com/instabase/instabase)`) goimports is restructuring the instabase imports as though they are stdlib imports
I'm not sure how we would have enabled sorting to the end previously, but I'll continue taking a look
Yea... our codebase has too many Instabase-custom conventions...
ah found another discrepancy! @Xindi Xu could you try removing this line (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/.vscode/settings.json#L17) from the same settings.json?
still sorts alphabetically :cry:

ok this is very strange, it almost seems like either the latest upgrade to go 1.22.9 introduced some new behavior or goimports just wasn't working before -- I'll keep digging around, would you like me to revert my PR until this is figured out or is this more of a "would be good to have" item?
I think we should revert it, because it introduces a bunch of changes for each file that I opened :cry:

actually I'm now seeing things work correctly on my IDE after removing that line :thonk: @Xindi Xu could you check whether `gofumpt` is enabled in your host's `/home/owner/.vscode-server/data/Machine/settings.json` when you have a moment?
ah yes, it seems to work now!
Thank you!
perfect!! will have a fix PR shortly, thank you for raising this :pray:
<!subteam^S08AA13VAFQ> can I get a review on https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/67621 when someone has a moment?
